Package com.example.cs309android.fragments.shopping

Class ShoppingFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.cs309android.fragments.BaseFragment
        • com.example.cs309android.fragments.shopping.ShoppingFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, CallbackFragment
    public class ShoppingFragment
extends BaseFragment
    Shopping list fragment. Consists of a ListView and a FAB to add items. The list view has a custom adapter that has a checkbox to strike out the text, a label, and a button to remove the item.
    Author:
    Mitch Hudson
